I’m curious what you think about the AngularJS changes with Durandal. IE: Durandal is going away as a viable option.

I’m looking into AngularJS now. I know it is the thing that everyone is using because it comes from Google but I’m very concerned about the complexity. I don’t want to build applications that only I can support. I’m tasked with defining the programming stack for our entire company and I don’t want unnecessary resistance because I chose an overly complex solution.

I want the SPA approach. What I’m choosing between is using AngularJS or building my own SPA based on HTML5,Knockout, SammyJS, and WebApi.

I’m concerned about getting on board with AngularJS now when they have major changes coming. I’m trying to find the best path. I know changes are coming and whatever I promote now will have to change when Angular 2x comes out. So I need a path that will allow me to work now but migrate without getting killed politically at my company.

Lots of loaded questions. I gave a lot of info because I wanted you to understand the position I’m in and I’m hoping you can provide some guidance.
